DOC.brief_title: Efficacy, Safety of Hypertonic Lactate Soln. as Fluid Resuscitation Compared With Ringer's Lactate in Post-CABG Pats
DOC.detailed_description: Prospective, randomized, open-label study to assess the efficacy and safety of hypertonic lactate solution, compared to Ringer's Lactate as fluid resuscitation to maintain hemodynamic stability in post-coronary artery bypass grafting(CABG) patients. Patients who were eligible received either hypertonic lactate solution or Ringer's Lactate post-CABG observed in the first 12 hours in the ICU when fluid resuscitation was needed.
DOC.criteria: Patients who have given their written informed consent. Male or female, aged 1875 years. Postoperative CABG on pump or off pump in ICU. Patients who need fluid resuscitation. Combined operations. Need for intra aortic balloon pump (IABP). Patients with severe arrhythmia (VT, AF rapid response, heart block). Severe hemodynamic imbalance. Severe bleeding and/or reoperation. Liver dysfunction(SGOT and SGPT 2x normal). Renal failure (Creatinine >2 mg%).
